description: '''Raymond Charles Jack LaMontagne''' ({{IPAc-en|ˌ|l|ɑː|m|ɒ|n|ˈ|t|eɪ|n}}; born June 18, 1973) is an American singer-songwriter and musician. LaMontagne has released nine studio albums: ''[[Trouble (Ray LaMontagne album)|Trouble]]'', ''[[Till the Sun Turns Black]]'', ''[[Gossip in the Grain]]'', ''[[God Willin' & the Creek Don't Rise]]'', ''[[Supernova (Ray LaMontagne album)|Supernova]]'', ''[[Ouroboros (Ray LaMontagne album)|Ouroboros]]'', ''[[Part of the Light]]'', ''[[Monovision (album)|Monovision]]'', and ''[[Long Way Home (Ray LaMontagne album)|Long Way Home]]''. He was born in [[New Hampshire]] and was inspired to create music after hearing an album by [[Stephen Stills]].  Critics have compared LaMontagne's music to that of [[Otis Redding]], [[Ryan Adams]], [[Beck]], [[Pink Floyd]], [[The Band]], [[Van Morrison]], [[Nick Drake]] and [[Tim Buckley]].
